Locals chatted over breakfast at its numerous coffee shops, pensioners were deep in conversation on the benches overlooking the village green and shoppers flitted around alongside estate agents and accountants.

But there is sadness, too, that the fans will no longer get to see the finest Wolves player in half a century pull the strings at Molineux. There were also tears in Nevesâ€™ eyes as he said goodbye on Friday.

Neves became the poster boy of the best Wolves era for generations, enjoying the full journey from the Championship title to successive top-seven finishes in the Premier League, an FA Cup semi-final and a Europa League quarter-final.
